revision.comment: Disambiguating links to [[Helical]] (link changed to [[Helix]]) using [[User:Qwertyytrewqqwerty/DisamAssist|DisamAssist]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Calico Light Weapons Inc | logo = [[Image:Calico-logo.PNG|220px|Calico Light Weapons Systems]] | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | genre = | fate = | predecessor = | successor = | foundation = {{start date|1982|10}} | founder = | defunct = | location_city = [[Elgin, Oregon]] | location_country = [[United States|U.S.]] | location = | locations = | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = | industry = [[firearms]] | products = [[Firearms]], [[Magazine (firearms)|Magazines]], [[Speed loader]]s, other firearm accessories | services = | market cap = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = [http://calicolightweaponsystems.com www.calicolightweaponsystems.com] | footnotes = | intl = yes }}
'''Calico Light Weapons Inc.''' (CLWS) is an American privately held [[manufacturing company]] based in [[Elgin, Oregon]]. It designs, develops and manufactures semi automatic firearms. The company was established in 1982 in [[Bakersfield, California]], and released its first production weapon in 1985. In 1998 the company's operations were moved to [[Sparks, Nevada]], where replacement parts for existing weapons were produced.<ref name="Lewis2011">{{cite book|last=Lewis|first=Jack|authorlink=Jack Lewis (screenwriter)|title=Assault Weapons|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sb9Ql8FBZlEC&pg=PA158|date=28 February 2011|publisher=Gun Digest Books|location=Iola, Wisconsin|isbn=1-4402-2629-6|pages=158–161}}</ref>
In 2006, Calico was sold once again, and moved to Hillsboro, Oregon, where full production of firearms resumed. Calico implemented a [[Numerical control|CNC]] machining process and upgraded materials used in manufacture. Additionally, there were minor redesigns of some production models to increase durability and reliability.
==Products== CLWS produces a line of [[pistols]] and pistol-caliber [[carbines]]. Calico firearms feature a top-mounted, [[Helix|helical]]-feed, 50- or 100-round magazine that ejects spent shells from a port in the bottom, making a [[brass catcher]] practical in various situations. The Calico 9 mm pistols, carbines and submachine guns use the [[roller-delayed blowback]] principle used in the [[Heckler & Koch]] series of firearms.<ref name="Lewis2011"/><ref name="Peterson2010">{{cite book|last=Peterson|first=Phillip|title=Gun Digest Buyer's Guide to Tactical Rifles|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_TOaNipXcIkC&pg=PA32|date=15 November 2010|publisher=Gun Digest Books|location=Iola, Wisconsin|isbn=1-4402-1781-5|pages=32–34}}</ref>
At the 2012 [[SHOT Show]], Calico exhibited a prototype 12 gauge shotgun with top-mounted helical magazine.
==View== Although reviews of the product line were very favorable, Calico is working to secure military and law enforcement and export contracts. Calico firearms have appeared in several action and science fiction films for example ranging from ''[[Spaceballs]]'', and [[I Come in Peace]]<ref>http://www.imfdb.org/wiki/I_Come_In_Peace</ref> to James Bond due to their reliability, capacity and unique futuristic appearance. The company tagline is ''A Revolution in Firepower!''
Calico remains one of the largest manufacturers of large magazines for automatic and semi-automatic weapons (50 and 100 rounds).<ref name="Lewis2011"/>
==Products== '''Current''' *.22 LR Pistols **Calico M110<ref name="HoggWalter2004">{{cite book|last1=Hogg|first1=Ian V.|authorlink1=Ian V. Hogg|last2=Walter|first2=John|title=Pistols of the World|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=okQH6zFgDtUC&pg=PA56|date=29 August 2004|publisher=David & Charles|isbn=0-87349-460-1|page=56}}</ref> *.22 LR Rifles **[[Calico M100|Calico M100S & M-100 Tactical]] **[[Calico M100|M-100FS & M-100FS Tactical]] *9mm Pistols **Calico Liberty III & Liberty III Tactical<ref name="HoggWalter2004"/> *9mm Rifles **Liberty I and II **Liberty I and II Tactical **[[Calico M960]] ''(military and law enforcement only)'' **[[Calico M960A]]
'''Discontinued''' *.22 LR Pistols **M-100P *9mm Pistols **[[Calico M950|M950]] *Carbines **M-900 **M-951 *Sub-machineguns **M-750 **M-900A **M-950A<ref name="Hogg2001">{{cite book|last=Hogg|first=Ian V.|authorlink=Ian V. Hogg|title=Submachine Guns|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7onfAAAAMAAJ|year=2001|publisher=Greenhill Books|isbn=978-1-85367-448-8|pages=126–127}}</ref>
